text: When using Plots and GR, I know I can “turn off” display of a plot on the terminal session by doing `ENV["GKSwstype"]=100` - but what value for this environment variable turns back on display (i.e., is the default behavior)?  Is there a list somewhere of usable values?

elements.text: When using Plots and GR, I know I can “turn off” display of a plot on the terminal session by doing
- but what value for this environment variable turns back on display (i.e., is the default behavior)?  Is there a list somewhere of usable values?

text: I have found that commenting out the ENV command and then restarting the repl solves this problem, or at least, mitigates it. Does this work for you?

elements.text: I have found that commenting out the ENV command and then restarting the repl solves this problem, or at least, mitigates it. Does this work for you?

text: Sure - but if it takes, say, 20 minutes to compute results, it would be nice to toggle behavior without restarting
